intro: Hoarea pilosa, commonly known as the silky hakea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, silvery-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Hoarea pilosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and resilience.
